Pho Avina excels in beef pho with its very sweet and not too oily broth. Their chicken pho has more of a Chinese wonton soup broth, but it's still very good if you're feeling a cold coming on. They also do a great job with rice dishes, my favorite is #58. The rest of other dishes they offer like spring rolls and Vietnamese sandwiches are good, but nothing to rave about. Although, they do offer very good boba drinks. It's arguably better than Viet Kitchen and Pho Thanh. I go here all the time for the past two years and highly recommend.

3 star without Boba. Boba boosts them up to 4 star.  Pho lacks meat and you will stay hungry unless you get some extra meat in there.  Kinda sparse with the herbs and the spices. Not the best Pho I've had, but hey, they do well.  Service is.. meh. They aren't really service oriented. Take your order and don't bother you style.

The pho here is great (as usual) but when we ordered shaved ice, the red bean topping was completely rancid (as someone who grew up eating red bean paste, it really shouldn't taste sour from the first bite). The owner did not pay us back our money. When they remade the shaved ice it was topped with the worst mochi I have ever tasted.   Beware of spoiled food here!!!!!!!

This was my first time at Pho Avina, but definitely not my first time with Vietnamese food.  I was in a hurry and needed a quick, tasty lunch on my way to class.  First off, this place is in a great location as it is less than one block from campus.  It is also clean and welcoming restaurant.  Secondly, the staff was extremely friendly; the gentleman who took my to-go order even opened my order to show me what was there and how to combine the ingredients for a traditional experience, although I already knew what to do.  Third, I ordered the #51 "Bun Tom Bi Cha Gio Thit Nuong" with chicken.  I waited for no more than 15 minutes as I watched the service staff effectively and quickly attend quests as they walked in.  As, I mentioned above the server who helped me showed me what I was getting and I immediately wanted to sit down and dig in.  Instead I drove to campus and hurried to sit down so I could and combine the cup of fish sauce seasoned dressing with the heaping traditional salad accompaniment and the noodles and meat.  Along with perfectly grilled and seasoned chicken there was a crunchy, delicious egg roll snuggled between shrimp and shredded pork both perfectly seasoned and cooked.  It was enough food for two meals and I will definitely go back for more, maybe some Pho next time.

I came here to eat today, ordered shrimp pho which I usually order, I noticed the change of taste and the temperature of my soup, which is not the ordinary, I found out that there is a new management since couple years ago , no wonder ! I hope they keep everything the same way how the original owner kept it,

Almost got scammed, be extra careful about your bill.  I came here on a Friday afternoon for a quick bite. I clearly ordered something that's 10 bucks on their menu, but on my way out, they charged me almost 17 bucks. I pointed it out when i received my check, the waiter was pretty nice and apologized, however, the old lady, who i assume is the manager/owner? was extremely rude. She literally told me, and i'm quoting "you ate it and you have to pay for it, you don't have to come back in the future". Seriously? This is like the worst customer service i have ever experienced.  Then she kept saying something about a "price change" which makes no sense because if there was a price change, why was not shown on the menu?? I insisted on paying just the 10 bucks because that is the price i saw when i ordered my food. I wish i can give this place zero stars, the old lady was not only unprofessional, but straight up rude. Although the waiter was a pretty cool dude, but still, there will be no chance of me returning to this place ever again.
This place is a good place to try out Vietnamese food. Came here twice and their food is still awesome. Drop one star for slow service. Anyway, I will still be back.

What can I say about Avina.. Well, this was the second time I've eatin here. My boyfriend and I ate here on Saturday afternoon, the place was very comfortable, almost all the tables were filled. We started off with an order  of  Spring Rolls and Egg Rolls. They both were just "OK" nothing to write home about!!     Then followed up with #34..42...49.. I know sounds like a lot of food, which it was, we took some for left overs. My boyfriend and I shared The Pho (#34) and  with a touch of 'Sriacha" (my favorite Chili hot sauce) it was delicious, I would definitely come back and order that again in a heart beat!   My dish was the #49 It was good,. It had great proportions of meat and noodles,  yet it was missing something.. I don't know what it was, it  just wasn't satisfying my 'Foodie' palate.. don't get me wrong it was good, I"m sure others would like it...But......Well,  Lets put it this way,  My "Foodie" radar wasn't going into over drive. lol.   My boyfriends # 42, he though was 'OK' he wasnt a huge fan, but enjoyed it.   We  have a little tradition between him and I, the second we get into the car, we  rate the "OVER ALL" experiance (Food, Prices, Customer Serivce, Ect).. We both agreed on a 7 out of 10  The great thing about this restaurant is the prices. With ordering half the damn restaurant. lol.. our bill was only $32. so we cant complain, we did get a lot of food, for our buck.  I can tell you I will eat their again, Yet I wont be trying to run anyone over to get their! :)

Been here a few times in the past and it was really good until I came back and it turned out that they had a new management and new people working here.  First of all, the new people working here was rude and gives a little of attitude almost everytime they hand our food over to us.  Secondly, we order a roll, seems like that roll was not even fresh. We barely touch the roll and the roll fall apart and had to request a new one Thirdly, I ordered the soup, the soup was a bit blend now not wat it used too. The flavor wasn't there anymore and my bf ordered the pork chop n stuff omg the meet was not fresh and tasted like I was chowing rubber. And also my brother in law ordered a chicken curry and the worse part was there was plenty of curry but not chicken to be found. Like really?!?! And when we complained about it they come out with the new order in less than 2 mins when we waited for almost an hour on our order and constantly asking for our food is ready or not coz they seem to keep  forgetting our food out. Lastly, we order a boba I love boba but for some reason I really hate there boba. One of the worse boba places I've tasted. The boba they use was so tasteless.  I would never recommend this place to anyone anymore. It's not the same anymore  :(  This new management thing was a bad idea.
had the spring roll and grilled pork vermicelli while my friend had pho. it was ok, but not the best I've had. the noodles were too soft for my taste and the spring roll wasn't that great.

I LOVE this place! My boyfriend and I go all the time and I recently got my dad and sisters to go with me as well and they also liked it. Even my VERY picky 11 year old sister was asking to go again soon. (she gets the crabmeat soup) I usually get either the build your own pho (with brisket and flank) or the crabmeat soup. Their spring rolls are really good too! Everyone loves the "snow" and if you order the XL size to share they bring you this enormous pile of it! The prices are very reasonable and the portions are generous. On top of that the staff is very friendly and accomodating. This only thing I don't like are the boba drinks which are, for me, too sweet and the boba in mine was mushy. Though that may have just been an "off" day for that. When I told the waiter I couldn't drink it he graciously took it off the bill. Overall a really great restaurant and I most certainly recommend giving it a try! (:

As a Vietnamese restaurant in Arizona, this place rocks.  I've lived in San Diego and Los Angeles and have had my share of REALLY GOOD pho, so I think I sorta know what I'm talking about.  Sometimes the meat in the pho is not as good, but overall good quality.  Broken rice dishes and vermicelli are good as well.

I've never had pho before, so i can't compare this place to anywhere else (hence only 4 stars), but i thoroughly enjoyed my food. For the record i ordered the meatball and shrimp pho.  if i had anything to do over, i would have ordered more spring rolls.  they were fantastic!  We went on Saturday for dinner and it was relatively slow.  The service was at a perfect pace and friendly.   it will definitely be a common stop.

Grant that I am even less expert in Viet cuisine than many others, but I know what I like and what's good to me. Based on the limited universe of Vietnamese restaurants I've tried, Pho Avina is the best, and has been so consistently.     Despite an enviably consistent business, the dining area is always clean but for any tables just vacated.  The food has been consistently excellent, the portions adequate or better, the presentation/appearance appealing,  the service always decent or better and the prices remarkable in a totally positive way.  An added bonus is the extensive boba drink menu, and the addition of a remarkable variety of Taiwanese shaved ice dessert combinations, always artfully presented.  These aren't the snow-cones most of us grew up with, and at about $4 and up, they should be something special, and though they may be old news to Taiwanese  and west coast Asian folk, it's a new-to-me delight in beautiful, ultra-light, cold dessert that I highly recommend.   If it's a little less appealing as AZ veers in and out of what passes for cold weather, have a hot pho first, and enjoy.  I don't think you can go wrong with either.

Great selection of vietnamese noodle soups. Especially try the oxtail soup if available.  Rice combo platters are also available if you want although not as tasty. Here you can also buy different bobas and/or snow cones.  Con: Place can be busy during the weekends so seating for larger groups can be hard.  There is only one bathroom for each gender with no baby changer. The bathroom regardless is kept clean everytime I go there.

I love the Pho and the spring rolls oh so yummy you have to try. also try the Boba I think it is the best I have had but I have had it at only one other place. The staff is friendly and everything is pretty quick to order. no complaints so far.

I like this Vietnamese restaurant. The food is always good and the prices very reasonable. The wait staff is quite nice, nicer than most asian food places. It's close to my work so I come here to eat quite often! I really like their smoothie too! However, they don't let people eat in half hour before closing, which is quite annoying because sometimes I like to sit down and eat after I get off work and I can't!
This was my first time coming and I really enjoyed the Pho. It was great. The soup was good and the chicken was good!

I love Pho Avina! It's close to where I live, and the prices are great compared to some of the other ones I've been too. The food of course, is great as well!  I usually get the rice noodles with beef meatballs...I love to add all the bean sprouts and sriracha to it! Mmmm so good!!! Their springs rolls are good too! I don't really like the mint leaves in there, but everything else is good enough for me to get it again.   The fried rice is supppper good! I've tried it without meat and with chicken, and something about the spice makes it sooooo delicious!   I've tried the boba there and I would say it's alright. Some other places nearby make better boba in my opinion.   Service isn't great but they are very quick! Perfect to go when I'm ready to eat! I would definitely go more if I knew of another Pho lover..
Food was mediocre and the service was non existent and oblivious. Will have to try a new place - couldn't come back here even for free. I will leave it at that.

I LOVE this place. When I lived over here I would go here constantly, like every week. It's very small and the service isn't the fastest, but the people barely speak English, so I'm not complaining too much.  It's definitely a legit Vietnamese place. The menu is huge! My favorite item is the rolls. They bring out a forest of garnishes - mint leaves, bean sprouts, carrots, etc. I always get the spicy pork. It's got nuts and chili flakes on it. Yum! They bring out the moist rice paper and away you go! The absolute best part is their peanut sauce. It's to die for. I asked for the recipe once and the little old lady (the owner) just laughed and shook her head and said, "haha no no...no." She reminded me of Superman's Hispanic maid on Family Guy.  Only con is their awful bathroom set up where you have to wait until the cooks are ready for you to walk back there. Kind of annoying. And they also can't accept credit cards for less than a $10 charge.

I've been to Pho Avina three times already, and each time it's progressively worse.  Especially as I start tasting other Vietnamese restaurants around the valley.  I ordered just a regular pho with beef shanks, and spring rolls.  Both of the dishes were very mediocre.  Lets start with the side vegetable dish they give you; I barely got anything.  Just a small clump of bean sprouts, a small twig of basil, a lime, and that's pretty much it.  It's just not enough for one person.  The beef broth tasted odd to me as well.  It does not taste like 2 year old continuously boiled broth, and there is a strange tang to it.  It might appease some others though.  The spring rolls was also disappointing.  There was two tiny shrimps and barely any peanut sauce!.  Three shrimp minimum is my rule for spring rolls.    Finally ordered a boba for kicks, and all I have to say for that is yuck.  I couldn't even finish it.  It was too sweet, and milky.  It tasted like they just poured a can of condensed milk into the tea and called it a day.  Their Three Colored Drink was equally bad.  The red bean was hard and undercooked.  Furthermore, there was barely any jelly in there!    The worst part?  It's pretty expensive for pho, and isn't worth the price.  They're lucky they have a monopoly there especially with Pho 35 closing down.  Place Pho Avina in a city with tons of Vietnamese restaurants and it'll go the way of the dodo.
This place has excellent food. Very flavorful and a good atmosphere. Andy was very attentive and personable. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for pho in the area!
I love this place!! I usually get Spring rolls hmmm very delicious with the peanut sauce, you gotta try it.!!

If you are looking for a pho restaurant i recommend going somewhere else, their pho is a little overpriced compared to others. I mean come on, 8 dollars for a combination entree? Theres more out there you can go to and would serve the same amount for 2 dollars cheaper and for the price here at pho avina, you can get extra noodles or other items. Other than that, the food came fast and the servuce is good. I would honestly go somewhere else though for a better price and dare i say...better quality.
Great service. The Pho was amazing and the Spring Rolls-OMG AWESOME!!!! This is my new Pho place. I love it.

Pho Avina is a lovely casual little place for excellent Vietnamese food.  The food is fresh, and delightful.  The menu is extensive and has all the traditional Vietnamese dishes I expected.   In addition to Pho, they serve other noodle (rice noodle and saigon noodle) and rice dishes as well as appetizers and salads. Under no circumstances would I compare it to Cyclo.  Cyclo is not a traditional Vietnamese restaurant... Pho Avina is.  I would compare the variety and quality to Saigon Pho on Alma school, which is one of my favorite restaurants.  They also have a nice selection of boba drinks.  I had a coconut one this time. I have had Avocado, Coffee, and mango as well.  So far, coconut is my favorite.  I think next time I will try taro.  mmmmm.... so good. I was so enamored with this place that I expect to stop there on the way home from work at least once every week or 2.  I need to add this note now..... since I first reviewed this place, it has become a real favorite of mine.  I stop here at least 1 or 2 times a week, and when I do, I often run into friends who learned about the place from me.  I'm headed there for dinner tonight.
I never liked Pho until my boyfriend had me try Pho Avina's Chicken Soup (#21). I officially fell in love with it!
Best Vietnamese in the area, hands down. If you want authentic Vietnamese food this is the place. If you want cool decor and a hip vibe, keep searching.
Their Chicken Pho was Delicious and I love their vegetable spring rolls. Service was great, portions were huge. Place is very clean we will definitely be back.

Their pho is excellent but I don't recommend this place. Service is extremely slow and they fail to check up on their customers. I noticed that Asian people are greeted right away here, they are served quickly and the staff is overly friendly with them.. I'm not the only one that feels this way! I took my family and friends here a few times and everyone agreed and noticed that Asian people get better treatment than whites here. This happened to me every time I dined here so it wasn't just a one time thing either.

Bad customer service, bad food, we order pho chicken for the little kids and we got a huge bowl, there is no favor at all. It was straight out of a chicken broth can. I order the crabmeat noodle soup. There wasn't nothing favor it was more topping in it then nothing. And my husband order grill beef; he said it wasn't bad. Never coming here again. I had better places then this.
Sweet baby Joseph, that is what I call Pho...  Coming back for sure.

Delicious Pho! . First time I had oxtail Pho ( Vietnamese noodle soup )t was delicious. They also have Vietnamese sandwiches, bubble shakes, shaved snow for dessert with fresh fruit. Very clean and very friendly. I will be back!

The food is relatively good but the wait staff makes it not worth it. I've been here quite a few times and they've always been rude, but honestly tonight I got to the point where I just won't eat there anymore. We came when they were busy, which I understand, but it took a ridiculous amount of time to seat us. Then they brought out waters and promptly forgot about us. For 30 minutes. Took making eye contact to get some help, and once we did it was snappy help. The food came out quickly but then once I went to pay (at this point we waited so long we were the last people there and they were mopping the floors... Couldn't that wait until we left so we don't slip and fall?) the woman behind the counter was totaling the receipts for the day in the register and didn't acknowledge me. No "I'll be right with you" or "just one second" she just straight up did not acknowledge my presence. So I left the exact amount in cash and got the heck out of there. I will never go back. I'm not going to come waste my hard earned money on rude service. I'll find someone with better food and a better attitude.

Ordered a small beef pho...huge! Broth was great, not greasy and very flavorful.  Finally a place that serves avocado boba.  Although food was great, if you use the restroom it will make you lose your appetite, hence the 4-star rating.

I've always liked the food here at Pho Avina, notably the various meats and fried rice. Their Thai tea with boba isn't the best I've had, but still decent. I'm not a pho/soup kind of guy, but am told that it's also good. Their fusion foods, such as the egg rolls and wontons are passable.  Service has a tendency to go downhill when the place gets busy. On our most recent visit, my girlfriend's dinner was brought out, while mine was not. She had two choices: eat her food in front of me or let it get cold. It took them 20 minutes just to bring mine out after we finally said something. I can't figure out if this is just the result of bad service or if it's just some kind of cultural difference, as it's not the first time it's happened at a Vietnamese restaurant.  If you want dessert, 90% of the time, they never ask you, so you either have to go to the snoh bar and pay for it separately (and hope no one steals your seat), or tell them when they bring you the bill that you'd like to add snoh to it. The whole system, or lack thereof, is just very disorganized.  The reason why I often overlook all of these annoyances is because their snoh is some of the best that we've found! Its creamy texture is absolutely perfect, as opposed to most places that end up with too much ice. The coconut flavored snoh with chocolate drizzle and bananas is one of my personal favorites.  Overall, I feel it's a very nice little restaurant that just runs in a highly disorganized manner. Have a little patience and you'll probably enjoy it in the end.
I love their snoh, I've had every flavor and just about all the toppings. I highly recommend the Taro, with banana, strawberry mochi, and condensed milk on top.

Let me start with the best part of the experience. The coconut snow with strawberries and chocolate drizzle was absolutely to die for! I would make the trip to this restaurant just to eat that again!!      In all fairness, they were quite busy and our waitress was brand-new. However, we did have some very long wait times both for dinner and for the dessert.  The food was very tasty, the servers were pleasant and concerned and the prices are very reasonable.  The restaurant was clean and they really acted like they were glad you were there!    We will definitely eat here again.

Maybe it's just me, but I don't like the kids serving the food.  I love Avina's. About 5 years ago, my dad and I used to come here two times a week for Vietnamese food.  It was so good! I remember coming to their restaurant before they even moved to this plaza. I know when it was Avina and just her daughter working the place. The food never faltered. I also remember seeing a family who had called ahead for dinner and she had all the dishes they wanted, done and served as soon as they sat down. I mean that was just awesome for this small whole in the wall place.  Now, I'm not so sure anymore. I do know after I have come back I have only had one visit to Avina's. I had Canh Chua with shrimp.  It was delicious as I remember but a tad too sweet. I had a Vietnamese iced coffee. It was a bit watery. It still gets the 5-stars because I love Avina and her daughter. The place serves good food for a good price. I miss the TV only having Vietnamese shows.   Dishes that I remember eating here that are always good:  Pho Tai Canh Chua  with Shrimp Vietnamese pork chops over rice Vietnamese beef stew with slices of baguette Spring Rolls Egg Rolls Vietnamese Pancake Vietnamese Ice Coffee  This is my general list of what has to be good at a Vietnamese restaurant. It's not just a Pho shop and it's definitely not a Banh Mi shop.

A trip to Pho Avina is a trip worth forgetting about. Swung by this joint for a Saturday lunch, the place was packed, with a schmeezly one server for +10 tables.   Questionable spring rolls with peanut sauce uncomfortably light brown and milky..luke warm broth in my bowl of pho (should be piping!)... and flagging down the server to order, to get water, to get a check, to get back a check was NOT cool at all.   Yes, I may be critical because of my Southern California descent, but I know it doesn't take a rocket scientist to make a decent spring roll or hire more servers when clearly needed. X-NAY!

Delicious food. Friendly staff. All choices have lots of info on ingredients and how they are cooked. Food came out quickly (within 5 min). Had the Pho in the lunch portion and it was still too much. Ordered the Sriracha chicken as a backup. Also very tasty. Would definitely eat here again!

All I have to say is this place could only feed children, the portions are for 5 year olds. I just got so upset when I got my food, I didn't even want to eat it. The taste of the food is okay, but there is really no point in eating at a restaurant that cannot even remotely fill you up.

This is the worst pho restaurant I have been to since a new owners took over, first the waitress gave me the wrong order , got home & called them, waitress was apologetic but instead of saying " ok we will replace it when can you come by, she said oh bring that back we will give you the correct order, wow she thinks I live across the street then I argued finally she said come by tomorrow & will replace it & then today I came back for the order but wow they put 1 1/2 shrimp & the hard part of the vegetables & the wrapper was all broken & the food just fell apart! Very bad restaurant & would never go back to this one! Rating is 0 Food is horrible

Do yourself a favor, and never order take out from here. Pho Avina used to be my "go-to" for viet cuisine a few years back. Having left AZ a few years back, i visted recently and decided to place an order there and introduce some friends and family to the traditionally accoladed "pho." At 3:45 on a tuesday afternoon I ordered 4 pho ga (rice noodle soup with chicken) and an order of spring rolls on the side. No problem taking the order, they ask me to pick up in a half hour.  I arrive half an hour later -as directed, pay my bill, and pick up my order. As I'm getting settled in my car, I have the sudden inclination to check my order.  Opening each hermetically sealed container they've provided me, I realize I am short an entire order of pho. I turn off the car, make my way in, and inquire about the missing pho. They say, "no problem" and apologize. I wait another ten minutes to procure the missing soup and its  botanical accoutrements.  Ok, "no problem."  I'm a bit perturbed by the situation, but I'm also a realist; this kinda thing happens! So I return home from my half hour drive, eager to present the pho and spring rolls to my viet cuisine newbies.  Low and behold, the noodles for all 4 pho orders are crispy, dry, and unsoaked.  FAIL. Somebody missed a vital step in the prep process.  For $50 I expect my noodles prepped accordingly. No happy ending here...no moist noodle for me.

Ate here tonight for the first time and I'm really happy to report that their vegetarian options are plentiful and excellent.  Had the spring rolls, the vermicelli salad, a curried pho, an excellent fruit dessert, and a simple tofu and noodle pho for my son.    update...I've now been several times, and my only complaint is that the food is a bit inconsistent.  It's never bad, and that's a good thing, but sometimes the curried soup is the best ever, and sometimes it's just okay.  Will I stop going here?  No!  Would I recommend it?  Absolutely.  But I would like to see the dishes be a bit more consistent...that's all.

Pho Avina has some of the best snow in Phoenix! You wouldn't guess since there isn't any advertising but I highly recommend coming to give this place a chance! They have unique flavors and fresh toppings for their snow that other places in the greater phoenix area do not. The staff is bubbly and very sweet. Come here for snow, you won't regret it !!

Place is great. Never had something that wasn't beyond tasty. Boba is always on point (if you've ever had a bad Boba experience you will appreciate this), snow was awesome and they are super courteous if an error is made.
I love their snow!! it's fluffy, tasty and beautiful! Glad they are in the west side!!

First time eating Vietnamese food. Tried the Pho Ga, noodle broth with chicken soup. Flavor did not appeal to me, somewhat sweet and different, not salty like a chicken broth. Served with a  plate of basil, cilantro, greens to add to the broth. Slices of chicken in the soup were dry. Vegetarian spring rolls were tasty but heavily deep fried. Best of all was the coconut dessert with kiwi slices, light and refreshing. Service was good.  I do not plan to try this cuisine again. Had a similar experience with Thai cuisine. Just not for me.

I've been a fan of Pho Avina since day one of trying their restaurant. I was craving some pho and boba when i came upon their review on yelp. So my sibling and i decided to give it a go.. And we loved it!  The soup was delicious! The garnishes were fresh and superb! Noodles were amazing and not too soft or hard. The place is a good size but is always busy! The restrooms are better than most vietnamese places I've dined at. The atmosphere is clean and customer service is good for the most part.  I love their bobas and popping pearls!! Yay However, lately there has been strange people trying to ask for money in the parking lot. I don't feel threatened, but these days you can never be too cautious.

This place makes good Pho and rice dishes. They offer hugh bowls for noodle soup. Their bun rieu is not so good. It's okay. I don't really like tomatoes cut into big slices. I prefer them really cooked.

Meh, this place is weak. Went here last week for a late lunch with a buddy who works in the area. I have eaten at several Pho stops around town (check my reviews) and this has got to be my least favority of the bunch so far.   Started with the egg rolls which were just deep friend and essentially flavorless. Ordered up our Pho Tai, and there was little meat to speak of. I mean, my homeboy had four gigantic bites and was digging for additional beef to no avail. The broth in the Pho (a much overlooked aspect of Pho) was really not great and the noodles were just OK. We ordered up a limeade to go with our meal and it was super sugary and not that appealing. The only enjoyable part of the meal was the check, but cheap Pho is not hard to come by anyway so.....   I don't plan on coming back to Avina ever, especially when I've got Maxim closer to home....

I've eaten Vietnamese food all over the valley and this place is by far my favorite. Particularly the BÚN BÒ HUE ~ Spicy Beef Soup.  It is hands-down the best version of this I have ever had. The broth is so flavorful I dream about it. It is incredibly complex and it's hard to pinpoint what flavors are in there, but you won't care, you'll be too busy eating the bathtub sized bowl of heaven.   Also amazing are the grilled meats, especially the shrimp. They have a delicious sauce on them and taste smokey from the grill. Awesome on the rice platter or in the "roll your own" spring rolls (a very light and healthy way to enjoy Vietnamese!)  Also of note are the rice flower crepe (allow a few extra minutes for this one if you are in a lunch rush) and the fantastic creamy curry (chicken, beef, shrimp or tofu). The entree comes with rice, BUT if you order it off the "sandwich" menu, you'll get a smaller portion (the regular is huge) surrounded by warm crusty french bread. To. Die. For. Not spicy but full of flavor and the creamy taste of coconut milk.  They can get pretty busy at times and occasionally the service is a bit slow, waiting to check out etc, but not always and it's worth the wait. Just ask for your check a little early and don't be afraid to flag down a server. They are all VERY friendly.

my daughter and nephew loved the oxtail soup and eggrolls, place is nice and service is good...they also have a variety of grilled plate than u can choose from and pork chop and grilled chicken are my favorite...taro boba and the shaved ice with varity of flavors and toppings to choose from is pretty awesome

This place was ok. The pho isn't as great as I had expected from the reviews. They gave me a small plate of veggies and I had asked if I could have a little more. I was unknowingly was charged extra for it and the quantity of the extra dish wasn't worth asking for. Normally pho restaurants don't charge for meaningless side dishes, but I guess I should've tried their boba to make my experience more worthwhile.

This place okay.  Just okay.  Not the best, but far from the worst.  It's nthing fancy, nor even memorable.  Just good food, and good prices.  For a quicl meal, it's average.  Nothing to write home about.

The BEST Pho broth ever! Their pho dac biet is the best with just enough to get you full and not over feed! Other places I may alter the taste with lime and chili paste but their broth allows you to enjoy the flavor they created with little to no alterations!   I LOVE Pho Avina!

Really tasty Vietnamese food. The place is very clean and the service was great. I really enjoyed my lunch and for eight dollars including tip, the price can't be beat.  I had the pho with eye of round and it was flavorful, hot, and came with all of the expected herbs and toppings.  I can give this place a solid four stars very easily.

My spring rolls were nothing but noodles...super sad. This place really has changed over the years. This was my go-to spot for so long when I lived in CA and came here to Glendale to visit my family. Now I live here, was super excited to go to my crazy busy, super good spring roll place I remembered and when I walked in to what has always been a packed restaurant, I was the only one at dinner time, ordered to go and got spring noodle rolls, no greens, no fresh herbs, chincey on the pork...super bummed. On a trek to find a new Vietnamese place I guess :(  New management maybe???

Pho Avina is "OK" at best. It is hard to give an accurate rating using a five star system. This place would rate a five on a scale from one to ten.   However, I'm not going to be too harsh just based on the principle that there aren't many options with ethnic foods in AZ so they earn a three for that alone.   I can't say the food isn't terrible, because it isn't, but it is definitely sub par from the Vietnamese that I am used to. I tried the rolls, pho and rice dishes from Avina.    Avina's fresh rolls were small, and as mentioned oddly sweet. The hoisin and peanut (that's "seafood" or "from the sea") sauce was also a strange pastel color rather than the dark purplish brown that it naturally comes in. Probably watered down.    Their fried rolls were also very plain. It was just pork in there. Not very Vietnamese/SE Asian if you ask me. What happened to pork, "wood mushroom" (I have no idea what the fuck it's called in English believe it or not), carrots, and "phun see"?    Pho is, for lack of a better term, the bread and butter of a Vietnamese place. Avina's pho was scant on meat, and the broth as noted by another commenter was oddly sweet (as a matter of fact, everything there that isn't supposed to be sweet was very sweet).   Another deal is this, every Vietnamese restaurant I've been to gives you size options when ordering pho. Size small for children and those who just want to dip their toes or watch their "figures" and size large and extra large for those who crave pho so much where one measly bowl just won't do. The herb plate that accompanied Avina's pho bowl was also on the scant side but I guess since the noodle bowl is small you don't need so many herbs and jalapenos to throw in there do you. Guess not.   The rice dish I tried was also a let down. Not on taste (other than the sweetness) mind you, but again, every rice dish I'm used to comes standard with a slab of egg cake and a small portion of a ground up pork, tripe, and peanut mixture, along with your pickled carrots, turnips, and cucumbers. The rice dish from Avina came with two cucumber slices, and a couple (and I do mean a couple) of other pickled vegetables. The pork chop was also small as hell. Weak.   Asian food (aside from sushi houses) isn't known for serving small portions!   To sum it up, Avina is pricey for the kind of food that it is, has small portions, and everything is oddly sweet when it isn't supposed to be.

This is our go to place after I pick up my wife from ASU West and we're both hungry.  I always order the chicken breast pho while my wife occasionally experiments with fried rice.  Their pho is great and tastes even better with some sriracha sauce (make a full red circle in your bowl) and hoisin sauce (make a smiley face).  If I'm really hungry, I can finish the entire bowl.  Usually I leave some soup and let them take it.  We're interested in trying their macarons since I've only tasted Napoleon Bakery (which is fabulous), but they didn't have any the last few times we've been there.  It probably doesn't help we usually stop in there during the week well after normal dinner time.  Pho always comes out quick if you're hungry and can't wait.  I've noticed their other dishes take more time.  I like how they make their broth from chicken stock since we don't eat beef.  I think one time they ran out and used vegetable broth.  It tasted okay, but chicken broth tastes much better.  It tastes healthy too.  You can't ask for much more when getting "fast" vietnamese food.

Was craving pho and pho is what we got! So glad that we went here. The food was delicious and the shrimp and pork rolls was bomb! The prices wasn't bad. We also didn't have to wait too long for our food. We ordered and it came out less than 20 min. My boyfriend didn't like the fact that they only had 1 size for the pho. And so I gave him some of my noodles.  We did arrive around 8ish which they closed at 9, so I expected to feel rushed which is understandable. Only complaint I would have...which didn't bother me much was that they forgot about my Thai tea, but luckily one of the servers went around asking us for any last call orders.   I would go back again just maybe not so late, so I don't feel rushed.

The food here is really yummy and the prices are very fair. If you show up before three I definitely recommend trying the sandwiches. The only reason for not giving five stars is because, like mentioned in other reviews, the wait staff can definitely be a crap shoot. I've had awesome,amazing attentive service and then other times the waiter isn't even listening nor bothers to write down my order then get upset when he brings the food and we tell him that's not what we ordered. No need to be rude to me cause you messed up. Trust me I'm more irritated than you are. Anyways, I'll be back cause the food is pretty good but just be forewarned.

Pho Avina has been one of my favorite restaurants over the last 5 years or so. More recently the service has been horrible. They are not organized when ensuring guests are being helped. I don't know if management has changed but since the staffing has changed they have not been very good. I've been very disappointed lately.

The food here would be rated better if they would take more care in the preparation of the noodles. They are overcooked. I was there with my boyfriend recently asnd specifically asked that they not be soggy and overcooked. STILL the noodles in my Bun were overcooked along with the noodles in my boyfriend's Pho. I realized that they have no intention of going to the trouble of preparing the noodles per order. They want to soak them in bulk to have them readily available for hours of orders. (This happens in fast food Italian restaurants too.)  No matter how good everything else is, the dish is ruined with soggy, overcooked noodles! It's so important that they be "adente". I complained to the owner and she shyly said nothing. She knows they are overcooked and has no intention of changing because it will be too inconvenient to cook them to order.   I'll never go back!  The best place in Phoenix is Da Vang on 19th Avenue between Indian School and Campbell.

Great food and fabulous service! Four of us went there for lunch last week and ordered one of the Pho soups. The "regular" bowl was so huge that we took the left overs home and had it for two more servings. The Pho was very tasty and hot.  I will be back often.

This is a great little restaurant in a somewhat boring strip mall.  Service was great and the decor was very fitting.  I liked the food, but didn't fall in love with it.  It could be my taste buds, I'm not sure.  However, during my visit there were many other patrons who appeared to be Vietnamese dining at the same time.  To me this is a good sign so if you're looking to try this place out I'd say give it a shot.

The ORIGINAL OWNERS just SOLD the place 1-2 months ago!!! It's under NEW OWNERSHIP and they are not Vietnamese. New waiters, new staff. You may still see the original owner there from time to time to help the new owners with the transition. You will also see some of the older waiters. They will be helping out for another 6 months to 1 year.  Been going here for over 2 years regularly. Loved getting the 'Bun Bo Hue' dish... I'm actually crazy about 'Bun Bo Hue'. My husband loved getting 'Pho Bo Vien' (Pho with meatballs). And we both loved the rice plates.   Ever since the new ownership, some of the food are not consistent and not as great. For instance, the 'Bun Bo Hue' tastes different.. still decent.. but not great... and just different overall. I used to think no one here in Phoenix can have superior 'Bun Bo Hue'... but I have finally found a place that does (restaurant is called "PT Noodles" in Avondale, AZ... rice is great there though... anyway... that's a different review). The Pho here is still good though!!  Some of the rice entrees have changed as well. Sometimes, the meat is prepared differently.  Never liked the Snow or boba here. They are stingy on the toppings. Go elsewhere for those products (I recommend "Snoh Ice Shavery" in central Phoenix)  The waiters need more training on how to be good waiters. Otherwise, they are actually really nice people.

My new favorite Vietnamese restaurant. There springs are amazing I like my veggies but they don't put unnecessary veggies. I can eat my spring roll without picking out what I don't like. There desert  is amazing I love the ice cream and it's up the street from me.

It may be busy, it may take a little time getting your food, but if you have a full hour for lunch or in the mood for dinner, it's never a bad choice. They have everything from Vietnamese sandwiches and soups to delicious smoothies and shaved ice with fresh toppings at a reasonable price.
Fun desserts & drinks w Boba  (did I write that right?! ) Shaved ice a new try for me & loved it...You will too!

Low key, casual, tucked away into a strip mall. I ordered the B3 with chicken. Taste wise, the chicken was really good. The pickled vegetables (all 4 slices of carrot) were a nice edge to the noodle salad bowl. They added that much needed crisp.   The fried spring roll my bowl came with was reaaallly tasty. I probably could've eaten a few more of those given the chance. Pretty sure they were pork spring rolls.  The noodles I felt were possibly overcooked. They broke apart completely during the mixing process and it really just ended up being mush, but thats not a huge deal breaker. The "tangy fish sauce" that was meant to accompany my bowl either never arrived, or it was the vinegar oil mixture they gave me in a plastic resealable container. Which had next to no taste. And it wasn't very fishy in flavor? So I guessed that wasn't it.  We also had to ask to order drinks. Because our waiter never asked us. Maybe this is typical for this type of place? I found it a tid bit odd. I didn't bother to ask for the fish sauce that was supposed to come with my meal cause I ended up using chili sauce as a substitute.   I cant really knock a place down for me trying something that really isn't their specialty. You know? I should've had pho instead. But I'm an asshole. Ill try that next time for sure.  My better half chose a fried noodle dish with chicken and beef. Noodles were over cooked, and he mentioned there wasn't much flavor. Again, they have pho in their name. Not "noodle salad".   We were still peckish, so we talked ourselves into some smoothies. Which...WERE AMAZING. My bearded bear man chose the coffee smoothie sans boba (he hates boba, he thinks its like boogers). I picked the Thai Tea smoothie with boba. I was nervous that they were going to be overly sweet with not much flavor but I was pleasantly surprised. The coffee smoothie tasted like great coffee. And my thai smoothie was perfect.   The main reason for the less than perfect rating (other than what I mentioned about the food and lack of drinks which were never refilled) was I noticed one of the servers sneezing/coughing constantly...while handling food..and cards..and drinks. If you're sick, stay home if you work in the food industry, otherwise you're a hazard.    Ill come back eventually, but next time Ill be a bit more cautious.

Im rating a 4 stars only because I did not have the opportunity to try the food. I had the opportunity to look over the menu and they seemed to have so many great selections. I will be returning! Anyways, I was in the area and noticed that they sold boba drinks and snow! I did not know there was any where else in the valley besides snoh in phoenix that sold it.   Unfortunately, my tummy was already full and I only ordered a mango fruit smoothie with boba. The boba was delicious made. However, the fruit smoothies are suppose to be made out of real fruit, that being said I believe my smoothie contained either mangos that were not rip yet or artificial flavors compared to the banana/strawberry smoothie my boyfriend got.   Overall, the staff was so attentive. We got greeted and had suggestions and our order taken right away.   Thank you!
Great for lunch! I had the vegetarian soup. Loaded with lots of delicious vegetables and tofu. Yum!

We weren't thrilled with this restaurant. The spring rolls were bland and the peanut sauce was watery. I thought the actual pho was decent. My friends remarked that there weren't enough noodles in the bowl, but I thought the portion size was okay. We also tried the Thai tea. It was too sweet, but not bad. Overall, we probably wouldn't come back, but it wasn't awful either.

Awesome Customer Service!!  First time trying pho, for my taste buds it was okay.  BUT what got me hooked and I will for sure be coming back is their shaved ice.  OMG!!!! Fucking Amazing. I expected artificial flavor, but it was so natural tasting, and so refreshing. YUM!!  Yes I'm a little ecstatic. must try..

I really like this place !!! The taste is good but I like people there. The servers look like they are brothers but all are very quiet but kind and don't bother you with over kindness. And their boba tea is the best in town !!!!

I'm disappointed in this place.  It use to be one of my favorites, but seems like it kinda gone downhill. The service wasn't as friendly as it use to be.  The Pho seems so skimpy.  I order a combination Pho, it's usually packed with meats but it only had 2 small slice of round steak,  2 small slice of brisket,  a tenth of a meatball... what the heck happened? Felt really disappointed.  On a good note,  the dessert was good.  They do really well with that. All in all i do like the place, just disappointed for today.

First time here and it was delicious!! So happy to find a great pho place on the west side of town. The service was great and our food came out insanely fast. The veggie pho was filled to the top with veggies and was in a vegetable broth. Out of all the pho restaurants we've visited, I think we like their rice noodles the best...they were cooked to perfection. We will definitely be back!

Rude and clueless staff. They were out of multiple appetizers one hour after opening. They had three servers running around and all of them were struggling even though the place was 1/3 full. We tried to order snow after and the waitress didn't know what to say and mumbled that they were too busy, then later said we should wait. When we asked for how long, she just laughed and didn't answer us. Other servers were either rude whenever we asked them for something, or just plain clueless.

The only good thing about Pho Avina is the fact that it's clean. Besides that everything falls a bit short; in terms of service and food.  Came in looking for a new Vietnamese spot to try and to curb our Vietnamese cuisine and boba/snow craving.  The restaurant is clean and spacious, not too many people were dining at the time of arrival but quickly filled up. I ordered the Clear Rice Noodles with soup on the side (Hu Tieu Saigon). It's a noodle dish that comes with bean sprouts, onions, clear rice noodles, slices of bbq pork, pieces of imitation crab, shrimp and chives. The noodles are tossed in a sweet soy and comes with a side of broth (chicken). The dish was lacking in flavor and portion. Even with chili sauce and a spritz of lemon, the dish was lackluster and just had a sweetness to it. It was 35% onion and bean sprouts. Totally not a satisfying nor did it taste close to what Hu Tieu Saigon should taste like. We were given a plate of veggies and the cilantro was wilted and the plate looked limp as if sitting out for past it's prime.  The service was a bit spotty, it was good at first and kind of awkward. A few customers ended up leaving because they weren't being helped though there was a good amount of staff available. At this point I didn't order boba/snow dessert because I didn't think the food or service was good.  Price is decent if you're looking for a mediocre bowl of noodles and slow service, but you can get better quality Vietnamese food elsewhere. The only thing going for this place is it's clean atmosphere.

I am in love! It's been a long time since I have had Vietnamese food. Years ago my favorite, regular spot was the old Avina's at 43rd Ave and Bell Road. Then the owners changed or something and their Pho broth changed and was really pretty gross, and I lost my taste for Pho after so many years of craving it. I read the reviews on Yelp and thought I would give it a try again because I had a cold and was craving the rich, flavorful broth that I remembered.  I went on a Saturday with my boyfriend who had never had Vietnamese food. We walked in and I was immediately impressed with the clean, welcoming atmosphere. They were pretty busy, but we were seated and our drink order was taken right away.   We ordered a Shrimp soup with Won Ton and egg noodles, egg rolls, spring rolls and the fried sweet potato with pineapple, along with a combo noodle dish with beef and chicken. Wow, wow wow!  We got our food quickly and everything looked amazing. The herbs that came with the soup were super fresh, and the broth was complex, so rich and full of flavor, without a hint of greasiness. Everything we ordered was amazing. The Pho broth tasted exactly the same as the original Avina's recipe that I remembered.   I can't wait to go back!!
We came here for lunch. The servers were attentive to us right off the bat. We ordered pho. It was so good and so fresh.
Awesome customer service. Genuinely kind. Amazing food, and they even have yummy desserts. It's a gem.
Pho with pork and shrimp is delish!! The pork egg rolls were delish as well , my niece is a picky eater but she devoured those egg rolls!!

The Good: The food is flavorful, fresh, and the menu contains a LOT of options. I've taken several different groups of friends here and no one has come away unhappy thus far.  The Bad: The worst I can say is that a few of the wait staff aren't as on the ball as other members of the staff. I've had both attentive service and so-so service here. Definitely good enough to keep coming back, but occasionally a crap-shoot.  Overall: While not a place for elegant dining, no one comes here looking for that. The food is delicious and the prices are absolutely worth it.
This place is amazing and you can end a great meal with some delicious shaved ice. Mango strawberry with condensed milk.

Being Vietnamese, it's not too often I got out for Vietnamese food. It's very hard to find a place that could compare to our homemade dishes. Although after trying Pho Avina, I can say I love this place! I discovered it because it is right across from ASU West campus, and I got out class early one day and had a mad craving for pho! I remembered seeing the sign as I printed off some work at the local FedEx. I decided that I was going to give them a try. NO REGRETS. The food is great and the service is exceptional. Walking in, they greet and seat you immediately and excitedly. It's a very quick and casual setting. They take orders quickly and bring out the orders quite promptly, perfect for tight school schedules. The first time I came I had the chicken pho and spring rolls. YUM. I really like how they added ground garlic to the chicken pho. When  I ordered spring rolls, the waitress asked if I would like the grilled pork, I said "sure why not". Traditionally it's usually just a boiled pork, but I must say, I am loving the grilled pork in my spring roll, add so much more flavor! I enjoy how there's a little bit of a personalized chef's touch to their food. Even though different, the chef pairs it so well! Since then, I've also tried their egg rolls and steak and meatball pho, which was also very enjoyable. So far, I'm really liking this place, they've got great food, service, and recommendations. -1 star because the pricing it a bit high for a pho shop, but I don't think I see that stopping my from coming back. I can't wait to try all the other dishes here!

I've been here many times and every time I've received great service. One time my food was served cold, and the friendly folks re-made the plate fresh and hot. The pho is excellent. I've tried pho around the valley and this is definitely one of the better places. The boba here is also pretty good. Family friendly, great service and great food.

Skip the fresh spring rolls. Barely anything inside with 90% noodles. Watery peanut sauce. taro boba flavor good but boba soggy. Black moldy bean sprouts in the pho. Broth flavor was slightly sweet and savory

I like to have a bite some times at this small place. I m not a big fan of pho, but I do like their noodle dishes. Sizes r huge, a lunch portion is enough for me to have a dinner and some big leftovers for my lunch for next day. They do have few vegetarian options and they do have tofu pho with vegetable broth. Boba is one of the best one. And they did made mine with soy milk ( I m allergic to any milk products- never had any problems after eating at Avina)  People r very nice there. Definitely gonna continue to coming for my noodles and would recommend.

I have been eating here since I came to Arizona 6 years ago. The foods (Pho, rice plates, and almost everything else) are quite good. I learn to go in small groups (3-4 max) and not more than 10. The staff informed me that they can't split the bill individually if there are more than 10 people. Otherwise the foods are great!
Very nice clean and sparkling.  Waiter was excellent.  Food was amazing.  Nice and spicy seafood pho.  Very authentic.  Quite busy but no wait.

Good Pho. Haven't tried too many other Pho restaurants in the Phoenix area yet, but this is pretty comparable to good Pho I have had elsewhere. The atmosphere is pretty interesting. There was some Vietnamese talent show on TV which was more than entertaining. The service was great. Very nice and attentive. The price was fair. From what I recall, it was about $9 for a bowl of Pho.

This place is my best friend favorite place.. I was kind of ehhhh about it because I know where good vietnamese food is at. Haha. Anyways good vegetarian options for me. Yes. Score. Very helpful and very accommodating.   Their vegetarian vermicelli was wonderful but next time I have to tell them easy on the garlic. Overall everything went smoothly :)

I love Pho and decided to try this place on the West side (since it is relatively close to my work).  It was clean and the service was quick and painless.  The Pho was good but not great.  I am a huge fan of Noodles Ranch in Old Town Scottsdale and Pho Avina simply does not measure up in terms of their Pho.  However, I very much enjoyed their vegetarian eggrolls which were very hot, not too greasy and had excellent flavor.  I will go back to try other items on the menu as they are very reasonably priced and their service is quick.

This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on the west side of town.  I travel frequently to LA, San Fran, Seattle for work, so I appreciate the great Vietnamese places there. But this place has the best pho in Phoenix on this side of town, and for reasonable prices.  I don't go as often any more because of my new focus on healthy clean food, but this place is still my place to go whenever I crave pho.

Not only was the staff fun and friendly but the food was absolutely amazing! I love Pho and have tried many places since I moved to Arizona six years ago. I can honestly say none has compared to this! I will be going back again and again!

This place used to be good with the old owners now it's just ok. Having lunch and the guy next to me cutting his toe nails and employees saw him and not saying anything to him. Well that killed my appetite. No more coming to this place

I am not a fan of this place but I've been here a few times with my Vietnamese friends... so I don't know, maybe I'm missing something? The flavor of the broth is okay, they give you a lot of meat, but I hate how quickly the noodles get soft. I like my noodles a little more al dente.  I don't like the smoothies and milk teas here either, they taste like the powdered kind, and the boba/tapioca balls are always too squishy like they've been sitting in the water for too long (starting to notice a pattern?) The Banh Xeo was good here though, pretty big serving good for sharing. I would not recommend this place, there are better options in the area.

I went there for the first time 11/13/15 for dinner.  I had the pepper chicken dinner, and it was very good.  It was as spicy as it can get, before a plate is uneatable.  Service was prompt, and courteous, and the place was clean.  If there were an issue they can work on is for the servers to talk more.  They are strictly business...not in a rude way, but definitely no small talk, or willingness to give suggestions for food.  But since I was with company this was not much of an issue.

Gonna keep this simple. We went back 2 days in a row and then again. The chicken pho is amazing(I get the level 10 spicy and request the unimaginable level 50 if it existed because I love fire and was told I was the second person they've seen finish it and down the broth completely in under 20 min lol.) this place is worth the try. And grab a coconut boba at the end too.

This is my second time getting carryout from here and both times have been nothing but positive. Food is always hot fresh and delicious when I arrive, the portions are huge, and it's reasonably priced. There are a lot of pho places popping up but this place has a delicious broth that is soul soothing. Family-run place with lots of parking

I've been going to this place since it was  at the old location. It's exactly what a small ethnic eatery should be. Great food, great service, low prices.   The folks who run this place really care about their customers and are always friendly.   Whenever I go to a Vietnamese restaurant I always order the Pho and this is good. The Pho Ga is fresh and tasty. The fragrant broth, cilantro, basil and tangy sauce can really get addictive. It's great for lunch or a quick dinner.

I love this place affordable pho tasty but pricy boba. Now they have a dinner option in the pho. I feel the dinner option is too much when we eat there. However, they only off the dinner option to go and it it more if a regular size.
Awesome food! Love their BUN BO HUE Not many Viet restaurant offer this dish Plenty of choices too They also have sandwiches and boba Been coming here for 7 years!

A good pho is hard to find... you can get one here! The lunch-time banh mi is spot on as well. Also, give the snow a try. It's like ice cream cotton candy! We come here a lot and it's always good. And get the durian boba! Just do it!

Pho Avina is good place to get pho, bobas, and banh mi. Came in around 7 pm to get couple of sandwiches Togo for next day, but found out they stop making banh mi at 3 pm. I will have to remember that next time. So we decided on pork chop rice plate and honey dew boba. The rice plate was exactly what I expected. The meat had lots of seasoning and very tender. The boba was really good. Perfect sweetness and chewiness of bobas.  Would love to return to try their banh mi!

New owner. Avina sold it to relatives.  Menu has so far stayed the same which I like.  They are adding new menu items I think.  Prices went up a week or two ago.  Slushies are delicious.  Food is great. Pho comes out fast. Veggie Pho takes longer because less veggie broth is made and is made fresh I think.  Combination plates take longer.

Love this place compared to Davang's and Little Saigon. My personal fave is the grilled chicken and their pork egg roll. Their oxtail soup is very tasty as well. They also have desserts to choose from...love the taro shave ice with wafer stick and banana. The price is affordable as well. Overall, it is a good place to go to if you are craving for some pho.

Open until 9:30 many nights. This is a plus for us late eaters. But the Snow desert closes at 9:00. So order it before 9:00. It may melt, but you simply do not want to miss it. I will eat desert first next time rather than miss it.   The pork chop is the best I have had anywhere and in any cuisine. The Pho is savory and memorable. They have cilantro. They have a wide variety of such soups. I had the mixed vegetable and meats in the bowl made out of crunchy noodles. It was huge with lots of beef, chicken and shrimp. It is served very vey hot, almost boiling hot. This kind of cooks the crunchy noodles but leaves them still crunchy. Don't burn your lips you will want to chow down on it. I am thinking of getting strawberry everything snow and munching bites of it between bites of the crunchy noodle bowl dish next time.  The noodle bowl combo is 12.00 and the pork chop 8.00. Our waiter recommended these two items as among his favorites. He was so seriously excited about these two items he forgot to give us the heads up on the "Snow" closing at 9:00.  You do not want to miss the "snow"

I like pho. Don't love it like my kids do. Yet I must admit that this place serves good food. Hearty portions...and more important, they use fresh ingredients. I may consider going back to try some more of their offerings. Huge menu with so many options. I came on a Thursday around 3pm and it was somewhat busy. I ordered the Bò Viên (meatballs) pho. Good choice. My meal was pretty darn good. The only reason I didn't give more stars is because once my server dropped off my food (with bill), I didn't see her again. As a paying customer, there's no excuse for that. Especially when I see her sitting 2 tables away, texting on her phone and eating her own bowl of delicious pho.

Great place for your lunch. Their staff members are so friendly. They show me how to pick up the right type of food that I would want. Their Thai Tea might be one of the best tea that I've tried so far in Phoenix. I'll be back again for sure! Definitely recommend this place to my friends and my family!

How does a big hot steamy bowl of awesomeness sound?  If it sounds great to you, you need to hit this place up, it is fantastic.  My wife and I have been here more then just a few places and every time it is great.  I don't know how many times a week my wife is craving some of their pho.  This place definitely has a lot more to offer then just pho.  Between my wife and I, we have probably tried all the pho's on the menu.  The chicken and the beef are always are go to soups.  If you are feeling a little adventurous there are some more exotic meats you can try in your soup though, too.  Last time I was there I tried one of their other soups, it was a spicey beef soup.  It normal comes with the tendons, but I went ahead and skipped those this time.  it was fantastic.  It wasn't the usual rice noodles that you get in pho, which was a great change.  It was a giant spicey bowl of deliciousness.  While we haven't got much here other than soup, we have tried some of the appetizers and some of the Bánh mìs.  They were good also.  The Bánh mìs are pretty tasty.  Some are better than others, for my taste. If you go you'll just have to try a couple and see which ones you like best.  Don't worry, it will be enjoyable.    With all these praises, you may be asking why I'm only giving it four stars.  That would be a good question indeed.  The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is the quality of the meat.  From time to time, some of the meat is little bit fattier and a little bit more grisly then I would like.  I understand that this meat selection is a huge part of what makes the broth taste so amazing, but It's my only real complaint about this place.
This is the best place for Vietnamese food hands down,I get happy just walking in the place..I love it!!! I have to give it five stars. Durian bob a is breathtaking(once you get over the smell) Lol!!
I come here at least a few times a month. If you enjoy Pho, you don't want to miss this place. If you've never had Pho, you don't want to miss this place. Eat here.

Their Boba is bomb! Always great quality Boba which has been surprisingly hard to find in AZ. But theirs is good. I used to think their Pho was super great but after trying out other restaurants I've realized their Pho is ok. Not great not bad. It's the quality of their noodle that bothers me. Aside from that I appreciate their ability to serve you quickly.
